III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
St. Clair County Juvenile Intervention Unit is a program operating inside of and
separately from the St. Clair County Sheriff’s Office and Jail. This 20-bed secure
facility is located on the first floor of the building. Upon arrival to the facility there is
a large parking lot where the front entrance to the St. Clair County Sheriff’s Office
and Jail can be seen, to the right is the entrance for the St. Clair County Juvenile
Intervention Unit. Upon entering the facility there is a small entryway with a
receptionist office and window to the left and second locked door that leads into
the main hallway. Upon entering the hallway, the facility day treatment area is
located through locked doors on the right side with the two St. Clair County
Juvenile Intervention Units through locked door to the left. Each of the St. Clair
County Juvenile Intervention Units have ten bedrooms that are located around the
perimeter of the room each equipped with a toilet, sink, bed, and desk; a living
space in the middle of the room; two private showering areas; a staff desk area
near the entrance of each unit; and one unit has a small kitchen at the entrance of
the unit which is locked and not accessible to the youth. Moving further down the
main hallway there are two outdoor recreational areas for the youth to use; one
with a grassy/garden area and the other with basketball hoops. There is a
gymnasium located further down the main hallway with an office space across
from it.
An Environmental Health Inspection was approved as of May 29, 2025, resulting
in an A rating. A Fire Safety Inspection was completed on May 29, 2025, and
June 11, 2025, resulting in an approval for licensure. The County of Saint Clair
approved this property to be used in this capacity as of December 22, 2005.
B. Program Description
St. Clair County Juvenile Intervention Unit is a secure program designed to
provide a safe, secure, short-term care and custody for juveniles ages 11-17
years of age who have violated the law, violated court orders and/or any
stipulations of their probation, and/or who are waiting to be placed into a court-
ordered placement. The program offers youth access to medical and behavioral
health services to ensure their safety and welfare as well as to assist them in the
transition back to the community. Behavioral health services include trauma-
informed trainings for all program staff, mental health therapists on-site, and
evidence-based programming models.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.

Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
